input:
Please update the following program based on this instruction: Make the pendulum thicker

Current program:
from vpython import *

Length_I = 10 # cyber input variable

# defining parameters
g = 9.8
theta = 5*pi/180
omega = 0
dt = 0.001
t = 0
b = 0.05 # air resistance

# creating pendulum
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=1, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01)

# animation
while True:
    rate(1000)
    alpha = -g*sin(theta)/Length_I - b*omega
    theta = theta + omega*dt
    omega = omega + alpha*dt
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t = t + dt
output:
from vpython import *

Length_I = 10 # cyber input variable

# defining parameters
g = 9.8
theta = 5*pi/180
omega = 0
dt = 0.001
t = 0
b = 0.05 # air resistance

# creating pendulum
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=1, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.05)

# animation
while True:
    rate(1000)
    alpha = -g*sin(theta)/Length_I - b*omega
    theta = theta + omega*dt
    omega = omega + alpha*dt
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t = t + dt
